Independent schools in Scotland have a record of academic excellence , which continued in 2018 with outstanding results , including single- and group successes in sports , art , music , and other community ventures .

With over 30,000 students across Scotland , these schools , represented by the Scottish Council of Independent Schools ( SCIS ) , are anxious to offer their students and parents the best level of service .
Independent schools are designed to prepare students – for further education , also at universities , for their desired careers , and for their role as a citizen of the world .
In the education sector , we have the opportunity to develop and implement a tailored school curriculum , and we note that modern languages are still popular and desirable in schools .
Nelson Mandela once said , “ If you speak to a person in the language he understands , you reach his mind . ”
When you talk to him in his own language , it goes to his heart . ”
This makes an impressive illustration of the fact that we cannot rely on English only if we are to build relationships and trust with people from other countries .
The results of this year show that languages are at the top of the tables with the highest number in independent schools .
68 % of students who have studied foreign languages have reached the “ Higher grade A ” higher class A .

The data collected by the 74 member schools of the SCIS showed that 72 percent of students reached a “ Higher grade A ” in Mandarin , while at the students learning German , French , and Spanish , respectively 72 , 69 , and 63 reached Level A .
This shows that independent schools in Scotland are promoting foreign languages as essential skills that children and young people will undoubtedly need in the future .
Language subjects rank the same in the curricula of independent schools and elsewhere as MINT subjects ( mathematics , information technology , science and technology ) .
A 2014 British Commission survey of employment and qualifications revealed that 17 % of the reasons why employers had difficulty filling jobs are attributable to a lack of language knowledge .
Therefore , language skills are increasingly imperative to prepare young people for their professional future .
These skills are essential in a globalised world , given more promising employment opportunities that require languages .
Regardless of the career someone chooses when he has learned a second language , he will have a real advantage in the future with a lifetime capability such as this .
With the possibility of communicating directly with people from abroad , a multilingual person will automatically be ahead of the competition .

According to a YouGov survey with more than 4,000 adults in the United Kingdom in 2013 , 75 % were unable to speak a foreign language well enough to hold a conversation , and French is the only language spoken with a two-digit percentage , namely 15 % .
That is why the current investment in language teaching is important for today ’ s children .
When children learn to speak several languages – especially those of developing countries – they will later have better opportunities to find meaningful employment in the labour market .
The schools in Scotland differ in their language offerings .
Some schools focus on classical modern languages , while other languages that are most important for Britain in 2020 , such as Mandarin or Japanese , will be taught .
Whatever your child is interested , a number of languages will always be available in independent schools , with teachers specialised in this field .
Independent schools in Scotland want to offer a learning environment that is well prepared for children , and they should be given the necessary tools for their success , whatever the future may be .
In today ’ s global business , languages are undeniably still important for the country ’ s future , and this must also be reflected in education .
Indeed , modern languages should really be regarded as “ international communication capabilities . ”
Independent schools will continue to offer young people in Scotland this choice , diversity and excellence .
